p: The Canarium odontophyllum Miq. fruit, also known as dabai, is one of the species of Canarium fruits from the Burseraceae family that exists in the Southeast Asian region. The trees of Canarium odontophyllum (CO) are largely cultivated in the Borneo region, such as the states of Sarawak and Sabah. Physical description of dabai has been reported previously; the fruit is usually dark purple to black in color, and it has oily pulp. CO fruit is 3.7–4.1 cm in length and 2.4–2.8 cm in width, with a hard 3-angular-seed (Khoo, 2014).
